revision.text:
{{Selfref|For a list of all Wikipedia portals, see [[Portal:Contents/Portals]]}} {{Selfref|For an overview of portals on Wikipedia, see [[Wikipedia:Portal]]}} {{wiktionary|portal}}
'''Portal''' often refers to: *[[Portal (architecture)]], a monumental gate or door, or the extremities (ends) of a tunnel
'''Portal''' may also refer to:
{{tocright}}
== Places == ===Inhabited places=== * [[Portal, Arizona]] * [[Portal, California]] * [[Portal, Georgia]] * [[Portal, Nebraska]] * [[Portal, North Dakota]]
===Built environment=== * [[Portal, Tarporley]], a country house near Tarporley, Cheshire, England * [[Portal Bridge]], over the Hackensack River in New Jersey * [[Portals of Vitoria-Gasteiz]], a Medieval tower that fortified entrances to the city of Vitoria-Gasteiz, in Basque Country, in Spain
==People with the name== * [[Portal (surname)]], shared by several notable people
== Arts, entertainment, and media == ===Gaming=== * [[Portal (interactive novel)|''Portal'' (interactive novel)]], a 1986 computer game by Activision. * [[Portal (Magic: The Gathering)|Portal (''Magic: The Gathering'')]], a set in the ''Magic: The Gathering'' card game * [[Portal (series)|''Portal'' (series)]], a series of puzzle-platformer video games developed by Valve ** [[Portal (video game)|''Portal'' (video game)]], a 2007 video game by Valve, the first game in the series ** ''[[Portal 2]]'', a 2011 video game by Valve
=== Music === ====Groups==== * [[Portal (band)]], an Australian extreme metal band * [[Portall (band)]], a Dutch extreme metal band
====Albums==== * [[Portal (album)|''Portal'' (album)]], a 1994 album by Wendy & Carl * [[Portals (album)|''Portals'' (album)]], a 2009 album by Arsonists Get All The Girls
===Other uses in arts, entertainment, and media=== * [[Portal (comics)]], a Marvel Comics character * [[Portal (magic trick)]], an illusion performed by David Copperfield * [[Portal (TV series)|''Portal'' (TV series)]], a series about MMORPGs * [[Portals (initiative)|''Portals'' (initiative)]], a public art initiative that connects people in different world cities through real-time videoconferencing * [[Portals (song)|"Portals" (song)]], by [[Alan Silvestri]] for the movie ''Avengers: Endgame''
==Sport== * [[Clube Atlético Portal]], a football club based in Uberlândia, Brazil * [[Portals Athletic F.C.]], a defunct football club, based in Overton, England
==Technology== ===Blood circulation=== * [[Portal venous system]], an occurrence where one capillary bed drains into another through veins ** [[Hepatic portal system]], the portal system between the digestive system and the liver *** [[Hepatic portal vein]], a vein that drains blood from the digestive system ** [[Hypophyseal portal system]]
=== Computing === ====Gateways to information==== * [[Captive portal]], controlling connections to the Internet * [[Enterprise portal]], a framework to provide a single point of access to a variety of information and tools * [[Intranet portal]], a gateway that unifies access to all enterprise information and applications * [[Web portal]], a site that functions as a point of access to information on the World Wide Web
====Other uses in computing==== * [[Facebook Portal]], a screen-enhanced smart speaker * [[Portal rendering]], an optimization technique in 3D computer graphics * [[Portals network programming api]], a high-performance networking programming interface for massively parallel supercomputers
===Other uses in technology=== * [[Portal frame]], a construction method
== Other uses == * [[Portal Peak]], a mountain in Canada * [[Portal Software]], a company based in Cupertino, California * [[Portal stones]], a type of stone monument
== Shows ==
* [[Bakugan Battle Brawlers (season 1)|Bakugan Battle Brawlers]] * [[Digimon Adventure]]
== See also == * [[Porthole]], a window in the hull of a ship
{{Plist}}
{{disambiguation|surname}}
